sentence: It was good to see the mainstream media today pick up on the benefits of dividend investing, breaking away from the usual fixation the day-to-day market fluctuations.
USAToday.com did a nice job pointing out how the S&P 500-stock index has gained 209% the past 20 years, but when you factor in reinvested dividends, the return actually jumps to 370%.
Reinvesting dividends is a great idea if you can afford to let your money build up.
If you are older, collecting dividend checks is probably a better option to provide monthly income.
Another huge benefit with dividend-paying stocks are the increasing dividends over time, which offers hedge against inflation.
Taking a quick look at today's market, buyers seemed to be a bit more content hanging on the sidelines.
Volume did ease up to 3.3 Billion shares on the NYSE and 1.57 Billion shares on the NASDAQ.
Nordstrom Inc. ( JWN ) and DeVry ( DV ) were two earnings plays that traded in the red following both companies' results.
Elsewhere, financial and commodity-related names closed mixed.
Blackrock ( BLK ) was the one standout to the upside, while Potash ( POT ) dragged for much of the day.
Looking ahead to next week, a decent number of earnings will be announced, including names like Walmart Stores ( WMT ) , Home Depot ( HD ) , Target ( TGT ) , Hewlett Packard ( HPQ ) and more.
